title: Kalshi 15m quote-data availability audit and scope clarification

summary.high_level: Session focused on inventorying available market data types in the current pipeline, assessing feasibility of adding missing quote datasets, and tightening the project one-line description.
key_decisions: Current pipeline availability: trades are ingested and persisted; bid/ask/orderbook snapshots and dedicated mid series are not currently ingested/persisted.
Feasibility assessment: acquiring missing datasets is high for forward capture (top-of-book and derived mid), medium-high for live depth capture, and low for deep historical L2 reconstruction.
Project scope statement updated conceptually: repository has expanded beyond ingest/normalize/validate into modeling and robustness evaluation.
Adopted concise description: "Reproducible, auditable research pipeline for Kalshi BTC 15m market data and model robustness."
changes_made: No repo-tracked files were modified in this session.
Performed non-mutating codebase/data audit via search and file inspection only.
open_questions: What sampling cadence and retention policy should be used for future orderbook/top-of-book capture under account rate limits?

notes_for_future_agents: When asked what quote data exists, anchor answer to code paths: `/markets/trades` ingestion exists; no active orderbook/quote ingestion path found in scripts.
Distinguish clearly between available trade JSONL fields (including yes_price/no_price per trade) and absent persistent top-of-book/orderbook history.
If implementing quote ingestion next, propose two-track plan: historical L1 via candlesticks plus forward live recorder via websocket ticker/orderbook_delta.
